body:
TLS is already supported, just use `'server' => 'tls://127.0.0.1'`.

But to specify TLS context, `RedisEngine::_connect()â€Ž` needs changes to allow set `others` parameter for [Redis::connect()](https://github.com/phpredis/phpredis#connect-open).

Yeah, that's what I'm doing in the example.

The problem is that you can't do that when using URL-based environment variables.

It would become something invalid like: 
```
redis://tls://127.0.0.1?password=....
``` 
instead of 

```
redis://127.0.0.1?tls=true&password=...
```

I could try to urlencode the `tls://` bit, but that's ugly if it even were to work like that.

Chiming in to say we also have to do loop-de-loops to accommodate Redis connection strings that may/may not require a `tls://` prefix (TLS is required in our cloud infrastructure, but not in our local dev environments).

Currently we're adding `tls://` to the environment variable `REDIS_HOST`, and using that to set PHP's `session.save_path` (in bootstrap.php). It will not work without this. 

But, we must REMOVE this prefix in our custom RedisEngine that is much like the one @Phally has. The Engine will not work _with_ the prefix present (the error is the infamous `php_network_getaddresses: getaddrinfo failed`)
Having an option sounds reasonable as it makes DSN connection strings easier to build. A pull request to `4.next` would be much appreciated.
Copy that, I got you. TLS default off for backward compatibility or on because it's TLS?
In 5.x we can turn it on by default but off for 4.x backport.

issue.title: [4.5] TLS Support for RedisEngine

milestone.description: New features and forwards compatible changes for 4.x and backports from 5.x

repository.name: cakephp
repository.description: CakePHP: The Rapid Development Framework for PHP - Official Repository

issue.body:
Pull request for  #17130.

- Adds option `'tls' => true` and can be used in the DSN as `tls=true`.
- Adds SSL context options `ssl_ca`, `ssl_cert`, `ssl_key` exactly as the MySQL driver has (to keep the API consistent).
- Other context options are now also supported.

I put the `connect()` and `pconnect()` calls in seperate methods to avoid nesting. Earlier versions of `php-redis` don't have that last `$context` parameter. It was introduced in `v5.3.0`. However, PHP 7.4 support was fixed in `v5.0.2`, so it is possible people are running older versions of the extension. I maintained the old signature unless a context is given to accommodate the different versions.

You also see `new Redis()` wrapped in a method. This is to mock it, otherwise it's a bit difficult to test.

Anyone an idea how to fix that PHPStan error? I think the rules are outdated. It complains `Redis::connect()` is called with too many (7) parameters, though it really has [7 parameters ](https://phpredis.github.io/phpredis/Redis.html#method_connect) (in later versions).

body: @markstory Is this something we could finish up?
Yeah I can take care of it.
This issue is stale because it has been open for 120 days with no activity. Remove the `stale` label or comment or this will be closed in 15 days
